npm-outdated-plus.configuration.level.de: Minimum *semver* bump required for a package to display as outdated. See npm's [Semver docs](https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/v6/using-npm/semver) for more details.
npm-outdated-plus.configuration.level.ma: It will only display an update notice when there is a major version update (eg from 1.0.0 to 2.0.0).
npm-outdated-plus.configuration.level.mi: It will only display an update notice when there is a minor version update (eg from 1.0.0 to 1.1.0).
npm-outdated-plus.configuration.level.pa: It will only display an update notice when there is a patch version update (eg from 1.0.0 to 1.0.1).
npm-outdated-plus.configuration.doItForM: What should be done when clicking the update action button.
Execute the `install` command of the dependency manager.
Execute the `update` command of the dependency manager.
npm-outdated-plus.configuration.majorUpd: Avoid suggesting that a package be upgraded to a `major` version directly. The suggestion will only happen if the user-defined version is the latest `minor` version available.
npm-outdated-plus.configuration.identify: Identifies packages used with known security advisories.
npm-outdated-plus.configuration.decorati: Displays decorations on the right side of packages containing more details about upgrade possibilities.
Details are colorful and much easier to identify.
Details are displayed in a simpler, less flashy, but still informative way. Helps performance if you don't care about colors.
Details will not be displayed directly, but you will still see it when hovering over the package version in a tooltip.
npm-outdated-plus.configuration.cacheLif: Time in minutes in which the versions of packages already analyzed will be kept internally. Performance improvement.
npm-outdated-plus.configuration.parallel: Defines how much packages can be analyzed together. A high value processes faster but consumes much more CPU. Set `0` to disable this limit (but use with moderation).
